sect1.title: Customising contents
sect1.para: This chapter discusses further customisation of the live system.

sect2.title: Includes
sect2.para: Using includes, it is possible to add (or replace) arbitrary files in your Debian Live image. &live-helper; provides three mechanisms for using them:

listitem.para: These allow you to add or replace files to the chroot/Live filesystem. Please see for more information.
These allow you to add or replace files in the binary image. Please see for more information.
These allow you to add or replace Debian specific files in the binary image, such as the templates and tools directories. Please see for more information.

sect2.para: Please see for more information about the distinction between the "Live" and "binary" images.

sect3.title: Live/chroot local includes
sect3.para: Chroot local includes can be used to add or replace files in the chroot/Live filesystem so that they are visible when the Live system is booted. Typical uses for them are to populate the skeleton user directory (/etc/skel) or adding configuration files where additional processing is not required.

To include files, simply add them to your config/chroot_local-includes directory. This directory corresponds to the root directory (/) of the live system. For example, to add a file /var/www/index.html in the live system, use:
Your configuration will then have the following layout:
sect3.screen: -- config [...] |-- chroot_local-includes | `-- var | `-- www | `-- index.html [...] `-- templates
sect3.para: Chroot local includes are installed after package installation so that files installed by packages are overwritten.

sect2.title: Preseeding Debconf questions
sect2.para: Files in the config/chroot_local-preseed directory are considered to be debconf preseed files and are installed by &live-helper; using debconf-set-selections.
For more information about debconf, please see debconf(7) in the debconf package.
